course_title: Special Topics: Film and Media: Social Media and Cultures
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 16Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course offers an introduction to various social media, including Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, and TikTok. Students will acquire a historical understanding of social media and their evolution and distinguish the various types. The significance and influences of social media will be explored in local, national, and global contexts. This course covers topics including identity formation and community building, media audiences and participatory culture, cultural and creative industries, and social justice and change in social media cultures.
course_description: Rotating topics in film and media. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: FILM 102 and (FILM 201 or FILM 202 or FILM 203 or FILM 204) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
